html: Jehovah’s deliverance of his people in the days of Hezekiah forms a classic model of the Davidic Covenant in action. All aspects of the covenant are operative: Jehovah protects his people “for my own sake” because he established his covenant with King David and his heirs (Psalm 89:3-4; Jeremiah 33:19-26); and he protects them “for the sake of my servant David” because Hezekiah, David’s heir and his people’s proxy savior, intercedes with Jehovah on their behalf (vv 17-20). In an end-time context, a literal “servant” or vassal named David fulfills that role (Isaiah 55:3-4 ;Ezekiel 34:23-31; 37:21-27).
